item.title: How the Democrats Became the Party That Brings Pencils to a Knife Fight
item.description: Will the battle over Texas’ gerrymandering lead to a new era for the party?

item.title: Can You Wear Pajamas Through Lunchtime?
item.description: A ruling on a dispute over the appropriate time limits for sleepwear.

item.title: This World-Renowned Negotiator Says Trump’s Secret Weapon Is Empathy
item.description: Chris Voss on our “dealmaker in chief” and the benefit of approaching life as a deal waiting to be made.

item.title: My Neighbor Gave My Injured Cat Morphine. Can I Blame Her for His Death?
item.description: He was such a perfect little guy.

item.title: This Quick Cake Is the Best Way to Use All Your Berries
item.description: This easy, generous recipe is the stuff of love affairs.

item.title: My Relative Insulted My Trans Fiancée. Do I Have to Tolerate Her Intolerance?
item.description: This didn’t come from confusion — it felt malevolent.

item.title: Is It OK to Request Custom Music in an Uber?
item.description: A ruling on how to please all the ears in a ride share.

item.title: Jen Hatmaker’s Life Exploded in Middle Age. So She Built a Better One.
item.description: “It’s like I woke up halfway through my life.”

item.title: A Troubled Colleague Asked For My Help. How Much Do I Have to Take On?
item.description: He says he has no one else.

item.title: How a Ritzy L.A. Enclave Learned a Bitter Lesson About the Limits of Its Wealth
item.description: Calabasas residents thought it would be easy to keep wildfire ash from being trucked to their local landfill. They were wrong.

item.title: Wholesome, Noble Superheroes Are Back. (A Wholesome, Noble World Is Not.)
item.description: This summer’s blockbusters leave behind the era of dark, “edgy” champions for heroes who can’t help but listen to their consciences.

item.title: Takeaways From the Times’s Investigation Into Syria’s Missing Children
item.description: The Assad regime took hundreds of children away from their parents and hid them in orphanages.

item.title: They Were Treated Like Orphans. But They Knew the Truth.
item.description: In Syria, the Assad regime took hundreds of children away from their parents. A Times investigation reveals the workings of the operation — and how one family fought to reunite.

item.title: How Georgia Went From the Vanguard of Democracy to the Front Lines of Autocracy
item.description: Two decades after the Rose Revolution, the former Soviet satellite is turning away from the West and back toward Russia. What happened?
